title: YOTEL SET TO LAUNCH NEW HOTEL IN BELFAST CITY CENTRE
subtitle: YOTEL is preparing to open a new location in the heart of Belfast. This upcoming hotel aims to enhance the city's hospitality offerings. Guests can look forward to a modern and innovative experience in this vibrant urban setting.
content:
The global hotel brand has unveiled plans to launch its eighth property in the United Kingdom and its first on the island of Ireland, in partnership with Northern Ireland’s largest hotel group, Andras Hotels.

London, UK – 25 September 2024 – YOTEL has announced plans to expand its portfolio in the UK and Europe with the opening of YOTEL Belfast. Slated to open in late 2026, the new-build hotel will be situated in the historic Shaftesbury Square in central Belfast, just minutes’ walk from some of the city’s most popular attractions, including Queen’s University and the Botanic Gardens.

Rohan Thakkar, Chief Development Officer at YOTEL, comments: “We are delighted to bring YOTEL to Belfast, a city that shares our unwavering passion for innovation and creativity. YOTEL Belfast marks an exciting step forward in our global franchise strategy and strengthens our portfolio as the 35th signed hotel, bringing our total key count to nearly 8,000.”

Thakkar further expressed enthusiasm about the partnership, stating, “We are thrilled to partner with Andras Hotels, one of the leading and largest operators in the region.”

The development of YOTEL Belfast is expected to create numerous job opportunities and contribute to the local economy. The hotel will feature YOTEL’s signature amenities, including smart technology, stylish design, and a focus on providing a unique guest experience.

As YOTEL continues to expand its presence in key markets, the brand aims to redefine the hospitality experience by incorporating modern technology and innovative design into its offerings.

With its strategic location and commitment to excellence, YOTEL Belfast is set to become a preferred choice for both business and leisure travelers visiting Northern Ireland.

This expansion aligns with YOTEL’s vision of becoming a leading player in the European hotel market, offering guests a blend of comfort, convenience, and cutting-edge amenities.
